page.title: 07MILVERTON CRICKET CLUB
page.content: Milverton Cricket Club has two teams which play in divisions one and three of the local league.They play on Saturdays and Sundays.The captain is Keith Jennings,who used to play professionally for Somerset.The club has a big pavilion which was built in 1978 with a grant from the local council.The land was previously owned by Mr.Tucker who gave the site to the club.It has a slate roof and a patio on which people sit to watch the cricket on hot days.There are lots of activities like darts,pool,space invaders,fruit machimes and a juke box.Most of the village children spend their spare time there,there is also a bar and you can buy soft drinks.There are swings and a slide to play on and there are beautiful views of the surrounding countryside.
